File System Management Service. Specifies the location of file systems in which DICOM objects received from the Store SCP Server are stored. You can also set up rules to delete the most infrequently accessed studies. org.dcm4chex.archive.mbean.FileSystemMgtService The default constructor FileSystemMgtService List directories (mount points) on this DICOM node. To separate multiple directories, use ; (semi-colon) on Windows and : (colon) on UNIX-like platforms. Relative path names are resolved relative to the archive-install-directory/server/pacs/. To mark the directory used for storage of newly received DICOM Instances by the Storage SCP on this DICOM node, add * (asterisk) to the end of the directory path name. DirectoryPaths java.lang.String List read-only directories (mount points) on this DICOM node. To separate multiple directories, use ; (semi-colon) on Windows and : (colon) on UNIX-like platforms. Relative path names are resolved relative to the archive-install-directory/server/pacs/. NONE = no read-only directory or mount point. ReadOnlyDirectoryPaths java.lang.String Retrieve the AE title associated with this DICOM Node. Note that only one retrieve AE title can be associated with one file system. RetrieveAETitle java.lang.String Minimum free disk space. The storage directory, or cache, switches to the next entry in Directory Paths, if the amount of free disk space falls below this value. 1MB = 1000000 bytes, 1GB = 1000MB. MinimumFreeDiskSpace java.lang.String If the specified file exists, this signals a failed mount. MountFailedCheckFile java.lang.String Make a storage directory, or cache, if one does not already exist. MakeStorageDirectory boolean Defines lower threshold of free disk space for deleting the most infrequently accessed studies. If the average free disk space on the storage directories falls below MinimumFreeDiskSpace x FreeDiskSpaceLowerThreshold, the most infrequently accessed studies are deleted. FreeDiskSpaceLowerThreshold float Defines the upper threshold of free disk space for deleting the most infrequently accessed studies. The most infrequently accessed studies are deleted until the average free disk space on the storage directories exceeds MinimumFreeDiskSpace x FreeDiskSpaceUpperThreshold. FreeDiskSpaceUpperThreshold float Enables deletion of studies in local cache if the studies are retrieveable from an external Retrieve AE. Database entries for the studies are not removed. DeleteStudiesExternallyRetrievable boolean Enables the deletion studies in local cache that are stored on media (offline storage). Database entries for the studies are not be removed. DeleteLocalStudiesStoredOnMedia boolean Enables deletion of the most infrequently accessed studies for which no storage commitment request was received. Enabling this feature deletes the studies and the database entries, so the study is completely removed from the system. We recommend extreme caution when using this feature. DeleteStudiesFromSystem boolean Defines how long a study is not accessed before it will be deleted from cache if it matches one of the configured conditions: Delete Studies Externally Retrievable, Delete Studies On Media, or Delete Studies from System.
Format:
##h (in hours) | ##d (in days) | ##w (in weeks) | NEVER
NEVER = deletion of studies is only triggered by running out of disk space.
Example:
52w = any studies that have not been accessed for 52 weeks or more can be deleted if they match the preconfigured conditions. StudyAgeForDeletion java.lang.String Interval in which unreferenced files are deleted. The Delete Files Interval must be less than the Free Disk Space Interval. Format: ##s (in seconds), ##m (in minutes), ##h (in hours) NEVER = never delete unreferenced files. DeleteFilesInterval java.lang.String Limit the number of unreferenced files that are deleted in one delete task. DeleteFilesLimit int Interval in which free disk space checked to see whether the deletion of the most infrequently accessed studies should be triggered. The Free Disk Space Interval must be greater than Delete Files Interval. Format: ##s (in seconds), ##m (in minutes), ##h (in hours). NEVER = do not delete of studies. FreeDiskSpaceInterval java.lang.String Enables the "free disk space on demand" feature. Services such as the StorageSCP use this flag to permit or omit the call of free disk space after their work. FreeDiskSpaceOnDemand boolean Enables deletion of files after free disk space has processed. DeleteFilesAfterFreeDiskSpace boolean Identifies JNDI (e.g: jnp://hostname:1099) with EJBs. "LOCAL", if EJBs are deployed in same JBoss instance.
